notes: Section 13 defines the multi-stage composition of deterministic operators that transform raw measurement vectors into fitness potential vectors
All proofs are complete and rigorous, establishing both mean-square and deterministic continuity
The deterministic continuity result is a prerequisite for Feynman-Kac convergence analysis
The section establishes uniform bounds on fitness potentials and Lipschitz continuity properties
Error decomposition into unstable (status-changing) and stable (alive in both states) walkers is a key technique
The corollary shows how the Axiom of Margin-Based Status Stability simplifies the continuity bounds
